Submodules¶

vlearn.fd_ops module¶

vlearn.fd_ops.copy_files(lst, dst)¶
DESCRIPTION:

Copies all files from the list to destination folder

INPUT:

lst = list of files dst = destination path

vlearn.fd_ops.list_files(root_dir, kw_lst)¶
DESCRIPTION:

This function lists full paths of files containing keywords the user needs. These keywords are provided as sencond argument.

INPUT:

root_dir: directory path kw_lst : list of strings containing keywords

vlearn.fd_ops.list_unique_dirs(rdir, kw_lst)¶
DESCRIPTION:

Creates a list of directoires having specific files.

INPUT:

root_dir: directory path kw_lst : list of strings containing keywords

vlearn.vid_reader module¶

class vlearn.vid_reader.VReader(vpath)¶

Bases: object

extract_frames(pocs=0, poce=-1, skip=-1)¶

Extracts a video as png images. The frames are in a directory created with same name as video. This directory is created in the same location as video. :param pocs: Starting frame number. By default it is 0. :type pocs: int :param poce: Ending frame number. By default it is -1.

-1 implies that frames are extracted till the end.

Parameters

skip (int) – Number of frames to skip. By default it is equal FPS of video. That means we get one frame for every 1 second.

nfrms = None¶

Number of frames in video

ply_time = None¶

Play back time

vfps = None¶

Frame per second

vht = None¶

Frame height

vname = None¶

Name of video

vpath = None¶

Absolute path of the video

vro = None¶

OpenCV VideoReader instance. This can be used to read video and its properties.

vwd = None¶

Frame Width
